Award.AwardTitle: Characterization of the Flow Structure and its Spatio-Temporal Surface-Stress Signature in Excited Separating/Reattaching Three-Dimensional Boundary layers

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
Abstract
CTS-0116907
A. Naguib, Michigan State University

The objective of the proposed research is to obtain by experimental means the characteristics of the flow in the separation/reattachment zone of a three-dimensional boundary layer. Such a flow is to be generated downstream of a backward facing step on an axisymmetric body. Surface stresses will be measure by a Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) instrument to be developed by the PI. The data will be made available to the fluid dynamics community as bench marks for the DNS and LES computations and the testing of turbulence models for such complex flows.
